description: Installation of freestanding 'InLink' electronic communications apparatus with digital display screens on two sides (height: 290cm x width: 89cm x depth: 28cm) (following removal of existing telephone call box)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

In-Link Project EAL-013 - Site and location plan, EAL-013 - Existing and proposed views, Planning Design and Access Statement (Ref EAL-013), InLink product statement V2.0, D0002 V3 - Proposed plans showing In-Link dimensions, InLink Anti-Social Behaviour Management Plan v1.7, Ealing Map With Removals
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The advertisement shall change no more frequently than once every 10 seconds and shall not include any animation or exposed cathode tubing. The digital signs shall also not display any moving, or apparently moving, images (including animation, flashing, scrolling three dimensional, intermittent or video elements).

Reason: To protect residential amenity and highway safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The screen shall be designed so that, in the event of breakdown, it shall automatically power-off to prevent flashing error messages being displayed, and it shall be so maintained.

Reason: To protect residential amenity and highway safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Option B of the approved 'InLink Anti-Social Behaviour Management Plan v1.7' (Page 9) shall be complied with from the commencement of the proposed development and for a minimum period of three (3) months and will not be removed without the Police Service being given a reasonable opportunity to agree in accordance with the escalation process detailed in the InLink Anti-Social Behaviour Management Plan.

Reason: To ensure that the proposal does not increase the likelihood of anti-social behavior and to ensure that crime and disorder, and the fear of crime, do not undermine the quality of life or community cohesion in the area, in accordance with Section 8: Promoting healthy and safe communities of the NPPF (2019); policies 7.13 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 (h) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and policies 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| The approved equipment shall be removed from the site when it becomes redundant.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The two phone boxes referenced in the InLink Design and Access Statement shall be removed prior to the erection of the new In-Link device.

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the site and surrounding area and in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).
